introduction.p: When we say "Express y in terms of x," we mean to write an equation that looks like y = \text{algebraic expression in}~ x We say that x is the input variable, and y is the output variable.
In particular, a linear model has the form \blert{y = \text{starting value} + \text{rate} \times x}

statement.p: Steve bought a Blu-Ray player for $269 and a number of discs at $14 each. Write an expression for Steve's total bill, B (before tax), in terms of the number of discs he bought, d.

solution.p: We want an equation of the form B = \text{starting value} + \text{rate} \times d where Steve's bill started with the Blu-Ray player or $269, and then increased by a number of discs at a rate of $14 each. Substituting those values, we have B=269+14d

statement.p: At 6 am the temperature was 50\degree, and it has been falling by 4\degree every hour. Write an equation for the temperature, T, after h hours.

solution.p: We want an equation of the form T = \text{starting value} + \text{rate} \times h The temperature started at 50\degree, and then decreased each hour at the rate of 4\degree per hour, so we subtract 4h from 50 to get T=50-4h

statement.p: Kyli's electricity company charges her $6 per month plus $0.10 per kilowatt hour (kWh) of energy she uses. Write an equation for Kyli's electric bill, E, if she uses w kWh of electricity.

solution.p: Kyli's bill starts a6 $6 and increases by $0.10 for each kWh, w. Thus, E=6+0.10w

statement.p: Salewa saved $5000 to go to school full time. She spends $200 per week on living expenses. Write an equation for Salewa's savings, S, after w weeks.
As a student at City College, Delbert pays a $50 registration fee plus $15 for each unit he takes. Write an equation that gives Delbert's tuition, T, if he takes u units.
Greta's math notebook has 100 pages, and she uses on average 6 pages per day for notes and homework. How many pages, P, will she have left after d days?
Asa has typed 220 words of his term paper, and is still typing at a rate of 20 words per minute. How many words, W, will Asa have typed after m more minutes?
The temperature in Nome was -12 \degree F at noon. It has been rising at a rate of 2 \degree F per hour all day. Write an equation for the temperature, T, after h hours.

Francine borrowed money from her mother, and she owes her $750 right now. She has been paying off the debt at a rate of $50 per month. Write an equation for Francine's financial status, F, in terms of m, the number of months from now.

subsection.title: 1. Plot points and graph a line

statement.p: Make a table of values, plot the points, and graph the equation y=-2x+6.

solution.p: Choose both positive and negative values for x. Calculate the y-value for each x-value by substituting the x-value into the equation.

introduction.p: Recall that to solve an equation we want to "isolate" the variable on one side of the equals sign. We "undo" each operation performed on the variable by performing the opposite operation on both sides of the equation.

statement.p: Solve the equation ~~\dfrac{2}{3}x-5=7
Solve the equation ~~2x+7=4x-3

example.solution: To begin, we must get both variable terms on the same side of the equation. \begin{aligned}[t] 2x+7 \amp = 4x-3 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Subtract}~2x~\text{from both sides.}}\\ 7 \amp = 2x-3 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Add 3 to both sides.}}\\ 10 \amp =2x \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 2.}}\\ 5 \amp = x \amp \amp \blert{\text{The solution is 5.}} \end{aligned}

introduction.p: The rules for solving an inequality are the same as those for solving an equation, with one important difference:

assemblage.p: If we multiply or divide both sides by a negative number, we must reverse the direction of the inequality.

subsubsection.p: Recall that a solid dot on a number line indicates that the number is part of the solution; an open dot means that the number is not part of the solution.
